  • Constraint programming on relations (CPRel)
  • Constraint programming on relations

Set constraints

The constraints presented in this section have in common that they consider a relation as a set of tuples. Under this assumption, we define the following constraints:

Intersection:

States that the intersection between relations \(A\) and \(B\) is equal to relation \(C\). The semantic definition for this constraint is:

\[ Intersect(A,B,C) \equiv \forall t: t \in A \land t \in B \iff t \in C \]
